title: Memory/City/Database
name: Memory/City/Database
description:
A Map by Infoconcepts

A collective map of our memories from other places as they are triggered by spaces in Philadelphia.

properties.name: 11th & Pine (matt trigaux)
properties.description: Posted by Infoconcepts11th and Pine, Philadelphia PAWhen I was 13 I went on a surf trip with my brothers. The first town we stayed in was the city of Carnac on the Brittany coast of France. The town itself was this small town right on the water. Murals, cobblestone streets, and vespa\'s were littered everywhere. I remember just trying to absorb everything we experienced while there. In that part of the country during the month we were there, july, it stayed sunlight until about 11 pm. There were tons of old bicycles everywhere and it was super french.

properties.name: 60's windows: Ben
properties.description: Posted by Infoconcepts

properties.name: Academy House: Meaghan Hartie
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsI remember one day, I went to this unfamiliar part of Staten Island, NY near Forest Ave and close to the P.S. 18 school. It was getting a little late while I was waiting for my ride to come pick me up from the front doors of the school when I started looking around. The area was filled with a mix of old homes and buildings along with a tall apartment building, stores crammed together and office buildings all surrounding the school. This building reminded me of the tall apartment building I saw then.

properties.name: City Hall (Marlena)
properties.description: Posted by Infoconceptsclock tower.

properties.name: JJ Sereday
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsThe place i visited was Quito Ecuador on a skate trip with the rest of the guys on my team. It was an eye opening experience to see a large city outside of the US. Here is a picture that reminds me of something that i would have seen in Equador.

properties.name: Jefferson Hospital (the new one!) Star
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsÂ Recently built, the Jefferson hospital looms above its neighboring colleague. With this luminous, glass building, there\'s a small park area with lush grass, which is refreshing to walk on besides the harsh side walks we\'re so use to. Primarily the glass windows and the visually open space within the building was similar to the colossal, transparent box-like mall in San Francisco. This I could view from my hotel window. The sidewalks around it were clean, and I could see the mannequins posed through the vast window. At night, the hospital lights are left on, and resonate the familiar glow the glass box mall emanates.

properties.name: Jenn - The Airplane
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsThere\'s a boy I\'ve dated off and on for years -- the off and on depending upon what zip code I happened to be in at the time. He\'s always been there for me. I was in a small college town in MO, and I felt like I needed some direction, or at least a change. He talked with me, both about us and about Philadelphia. I decided to come out and visit him. When I stepped off the plane, I was shaking. I called; he said he was on his way. I remember the clarity of vision, and how it wildly contrasted with the fog, and the nerves, in my head. My mind was racing; I passed hundreds of exhausted, happy, irate, reunited, estranged, lonely, exhilarated people along the way, but did not spare them more than a glance, because I knew I wouldn\'t find him there. Finally, I arrived at the baggage terminal. I watched people, feeling as though I had never been so nervous in my life. I cast around, looking for a place to perch myself and attempt to look comfortable. I remember the exact position I placed myself in; I remember the lights, so dark because of the stormy sky looking on yet so illuminated by the florescence and the people. I remember seeing people but not really \'seeing\' them, my eyes darting this way and that to catch sight of him. I remember when he finally came. I remember the exact, goofy grin on his face, the way he cut through people without meaning to (he\'s a big guy). I remember the nervousness floating away, and though it was a dark, very stormy, rainy night, it felt as though the sky could not have been brighter. I remember the cold air, alarming yet soothing, once you got used to it, and ducking in the rain, laughing. The streets smelled like rain and muck; it could not have been a drearier night, yet I remember feeling as though the world could not have been brighter... And by this, I knew I\'d found home. *** The plane was the first thing I saw outside. It was a pretty powerful reminder of the journey. (13th and Walnut) The parking garage reminded me simultaneously of the lights in the terminal, and the lights and ceiling structure of the garage we cut through. (13th and Walnut) The picture of the woman crossing with the people approaching reminded me of the people who just seemed to keep pouring out of that baggage terminal from all directions, all walking my direction, and the struggle to try to spot him through all the crowds and the noise. (16th and Locust) The skyline picture reminded me of how I could not resist looking up, even at the potential expense of walking into a wide assortment of objects... Directly. (17th and Pine) The picture of the pretty walkway with the speed sign reminded me of the long, endless stretch of road ahead of us as we walked, and how pretty it was in its right. (17th and Smedlers) The puddle and the storm clouds were clear references to the dark and the rain. My only regret about these pictures is that I could not take them later at night. (Hicks, Broad and Pine) The end! ^_^

properties.name: Kerry G
properties.description: Posted by Infoconceptsall the fancy stores on walnut

properties.name: Kylie- 13th and Locust
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsI went on a hike on the island of Kaui in Hawaii with my family. It was a steep path dirt path, with rocks to catch your feet on, with lush vegetation alongside it. There were many beautiful bright flowers along with palm trees. We walked higher than I\'ve ever been before. We could view the ocean from one point, where the bright blue horizon of the ocean blended into the blue sky, making one singular canvas. It was very hot and clear out. I felt tired and anxious. Other people were on this hike, adults and children, walking along at their own pace. I felt anxious and tired, but happy

properties.name: Liberty Towers
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsThese buildings are representations of some of the greatest architectural achievements of our culture, just as the pyramids are that I visited in Mexico for the Mayans.

properties.name: Old Houses on Carlisle St: Meaghan Hartie
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsI remember one day, I went to this unfamiliar part of Staten Island, NY near Forest Ave and close to the P.S. 18 school. The area was filled with a mix of old homes and buildings along with a tall apartment building, stores crammed together and office buildings all surrounding the school. These nice old homes remind me of the lovely old homes that were behind the P.S. 18 school building.

properties.name: Row of Trees - John Waller
properties.description: Posted by Infoconcepts280 S. Hutchinson St. Philadelphia, PAIn Culpeper County, VA I saw, smelled, and felt the following: one long road | sparsely placed houses and farmland | soybean crops | smell of fresh air| cars and diesel trucks | cats | roosters and chickens |a sign for wolf pups | many trees, lots of grass, a sea of green | clear blue sky | warm | firewood | telephone poles & wires | gravel driveway | feeling detached, separated from home, isolated from technology, longing for internet

properties.name: The entrance of the Jefferson hospital
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsÂ

properties.name: Tree leaves_Star
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsGreen, narrow leaves that remind me of the palm trees in San Francisco. They\'re everywhere and they bring about the urban area a sense of life. It\'s a dichotomy between the life on the streets bustling with artificial lights from cars, crazy tourists vs. friendly bums. The palm trees stood tall with the occasional breeze bustling through. It was a resting point for the eyes when the streets below were too overwhelming. It enhanced the San Francisco urban experience--being another attribute and reason for why I would love to live there some day.

properties.name: Trees & Brick (Marlena)
properties.description: Posted by Infoconceptsthe corner of 12th and pine. has lots of trees and red brick building that doesn\'t give as much of a city feel.

properties.name: Tsveta
properties.description: Posted by Infoconcepts1228 Spruce StrNice, France, small street close to the touristic zone and the central part. Two blocks from the street that goes along the shore of the Angel bay. At the end of the street there is a big square, with flower garden on the one side and a big circle fountain on the other. The houses are old but very colorful and bright. It smells like the Mediterranean sea and fruits.There are people everywhere. Small expensive restaurants, cafes and ice cream gellaterias are everywhere down the street. The weather is hot and humid. The plants are exotic and there are fruit trees and flowers everywhere. My sister, her boyfriend and my ex(who\'s my best friend) are with me. We are exited and happy to see each other after a long time in this beautiful place. I\'m thinking I never wanna leave this place.

properties.name: Tsveta
properties.description: Posted by Infoconcepts1513 Brown StrJoe\'s place reminds of the warmth and friendly atmosphere in Nice. Again mostly the light and people with who I am give me that feeling, not the similarity in the view.

properties.name: Vin Baratta
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsI was in Italy it was the middle of summer i was over my friends house and i was walking down his marble stairs and he was talking to me and i slipped down the stairs and busted my ass.

properties.name: Washington Square Park_Star
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsÂ I was unable to get a photo b/c my blue tooth phone capabilities ran out due to shortage of battery power. This park reminded me of a similar park in San Francisco that I was able to view from the King George IV hotel. It was spacious with lamp lights placed around the edges of the perimeter. There were benches where young hooligans with nothing better to do would hang out with their peers. It\'s a nice space to hacky-sack. Like Washington Square, there was a nice green area where the grass was vibrant, and palm trees surrounded flower beds that were scattered throughout the park. I remember having a great sense of relief whenever I sat at that park even though it was fairly close to a busy intersection. Still, it encompassed a sense of serenity and light fun to watch the people walking by.

properties.name: XPress FoodMart/SubWay shop: Meaghan Hartie
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsÂ I remember one day, I went to this unfamiliar part of Staten Island, NY near Forest Ave and close to the P.S. 18 school. It was getting a little late while I was waiting for my ride to come pick me up from the front doors of the school when I started looking around. The area was filled with a mix of old homes and buildings along with a tall apartment building, stores crammed together and office buildings all surrounding the school. These two stores reminded me of the stores that were crammed together in the corner of two big buildings where there was also a Subway shop.

properties.name: elizabeth: apartment door
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsIt\'s like a wrought iron representation of the rain forest...

properties.name: elizabeth: around city hall
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsWe went to Cosat Rica when I was seven. One day, we walked through the rain forest, up a mountain. It was humid and the birds were screaming and the smell of sulfur was unbearable. When we reached the top, the trees had cleared and we looked out onto a huge volcano. The volcano looked more like a crater than any volcano I had ever seen. As we got closer, someone picked me up by my ankles and held me over the volcano. I screamed and breathed in a lungful of sulfur. I thought I was going to fall into the volcano for sure. When I ride my bike around city hall, at this very intersection, I\'m alway feel the same as I did when I was hanging over the volcano. And the smell of exhaust could suffocate anyone.

properties.name: elizabeth: city hall subway entrance
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsThis subway entrance has always reminded me of the volcano. It looks more like a huge hole in the ground, rather than an entrance underground.

properties.name: prof.jbeau
properties.description: Posted by InfoconceptsBerlin, Germany, in the summer of 2005. After discovering the first Mess Punkt (measuring points) on the sidewalks of the city, i began to collect photos of the various types of points as I found them. Obsessively, I scanned the ground for these, growing my collection as fast as I could, trying to assemble some kind of typology of the things. They were spiked through the cracks of the pavers, pavers of many different shapes and material... lines connecting dots. The sun would cast the faintest shadow from the low relief of the metal points. I remember plotting the points, thinking ahead to the time when I would remember them (as I am now) and plot a map of my wanderings in Berlin.
